strings.Value: "We'll accept their offer and send Restov the year's taxes from Oleg's Trading Post. We'll also improve the road between Restov and the post."
"In that case, we'll have to permanently station guards at Oleg's Trading Post. Perhaps even turn it into a military checkpoint."
"I've no interest in crossing the Swordlords over Oleg's Trading Post. Perhaps we could send them a sum of gold as compensation."
"This is no time to be pressuring our allies."
"So be it. I'll suggest the Aldori renovate the road to Oleg's post, since they want to continue collecting taxes for the Restov treasury from him."
"We can't openly confront Jamandi. We'll bide our time — declare we've begun working on the road. There was no mention of a specific time line for the renovation, was there?"
"Thank you, Kassil. We'll repair the road."
"I value what the Aldori have done for me."
"That's all well and good, but perhaps the Swordlords should consider doing something for the trading post they want to collect taxes from."
{n}Lander purses his lips and shrugs.{/n} "Pay them off? Not the wisest decision, but... suit yourself."

"The {g|Swordlords}Swordlords{/g} are most satisfied by your decision to leave Oleg's Trading Post under {g|Restov}Restov's{/g} jurisdiction, even though it formally belongs to our barony. Here, {g|oleg_leftforbrevoy}read for yourself{/g}."

"The {g|Swordlords}Swordlords{/g}' reaction to your request for jurisdiction over Oleg's Trading Post is... rather cold, as though they'd never considered that {g|Restov}Restov{/g} shouldn't be collecting taxes from the subjects of other rulers. Now they are demanding compensation — not only in gold, but also in form of repairing a road from the Trading Post to Restov." {n}Lander rolls his eyes.{/n} "{g|oleg_forgiven}Read for yourself,{/g} if you wish. It's quite entertaining."

"Predictably, the {g|Swordlords}Swordlords{/g} are furious that {g|Restov}Restov{/g} couldn't collect Oleg's taxes for the month." {n}A satisfied grin curves Lander's mouth.{/n} "Also unsurprisingly, there's little they can do about it beyond stomp their feet and rattle their scabbards. Here, read for yourself — it's a light but entertaining {g|oleg_secured}read{/g}."
{n}Lander doesn't even try to pretend he isn't gloating.{/n} "I'm positive the {g|Swordlords}Swordlords{/g} will hate this. I'm all for it!"

"I'm still amazed by your decision, but what's done is done. A bit of advice: squeeze anything you can out of Jamandi for this — anything at all. If the Aldori are so proud of this alliance, make them actually contribute to it rather than just keep hoarding YOUR tax money."
"I would advise you to be more... resolute, let's say, in your dealings with the {g|Swordlords}Swordlords{/g}. Don't fall for their diplomatic frills." {n}Lander gives a dissatisfied cough.{/n}
"Perfect! The road will be of great use to us as well."
"Of course, of course!" {n}Lander spreads his arms in conciliation, though he doesn't seem to be convinced.{/n}

"You just leave that to me! They'll get their renovation, don't you doubt. Believe me, I know all there is to know about showing a flurry of activity without actually doing anything." {n}Lander smiles, a rare sight indeed — he finally looks less arrogant than usual.{/n}

"As expected, Swordlord Jamandi is both perplexed and grieved by your {d|c21 Capture OTP}decision{/d} to take the trading post away from {g|Restov}Restov{/g}. Still, you should probably read {g|oleg_secured}the letter{/g} for yourself."

"I must admit, Lady Jamandi wasn't pleased by your {d|c21 Claim OTP}request{/d} to surrender jurisdiction {g|oleg_forgiven}over Oleg's Trading Post to you.{/g} The Aldori take matters of allegiance and loyalty very seriously. Nevertheless, I was able to convey your position and clear the air. I believe I'll be able to persuade the Aldori to not demand a year's worth of Oleg's taxes from you. However, repairing the road falls entirely to us."

"Lady Jamandi truly appreciates your {d|c21 Left OTP}decision{/d} to not lay claim on the taxes from Oleg's Trading Post. Here's {g|oleg_leftforbrevoy}the letter{/g}. I was also instructed to express the lady's most sincere gratitude for your loyalty to our alliance, as well as the wisdom you showed in your decision."

"Lady Jamandi, in her typical sensationalist manner, expresses her extreme dissatisfaction with your decision to take Oleg's Trading Post from {g|Restov}Restov{/g}. Here's {g|oleg_secured}the letter{/g} — I hope you enjoy the wording."

"Lady Jamandi is, to put it lightly, puzzled by your request for {g|Restov}Restov{/g} to surrender Oleg's Trading Post. She's demanding compensation — not only in gold, but also in form of repairing a road from the Trading Post to Restov. Go ahead and {g|oleg_forgiven}read it{/g} — it's marvelous."

"Lady Jamandi has written a {g|oleg_leftforbrevoy}whole two lines{/g} expressing her gratitude for deciding to not take back taxation rights for a trading post located in your own lands. How typical of the Aldori!"
{n}Kassil's face brightens.{/n} "I'm glad to hear that you still value the friendship of the Aldori, Your Grace. {g|Restov}Restov{/g} is bound to accept a financial compensation."
"What, you've decided to go back on the issue after all?" {n}Shandra purses her lips.{/n} "Well then. I suppose sending Jamandi a few coppers might help settle her down, at least."
"I cannot adequately express my worry over this decision, Your Grace. I can only repeat myself: it is unwise to squander one's friends."
"Hard times call for hard measures." {n}Shandra nods in approval.{/n}

{n}Kassil sighs.{/n} "I would advise you to not put on a show in a matter where honesty would be both more appropriate and more profitable. However, the matter is yours to decide. Your lands, your roads."
"I did warn you that the Aldori would find a way to turn a profit on this issue, didn't I? In politics, softness is always taken as weakness."
"My pleasure, Your Grace. The new road will increase trade with {g|Restov}Restov{/g}, which should profit everyone involved."
"Half-measures." {n}Shandra winces.{/n} "It would have been easier to just give Jamandi a slap on the wrist at the start. But this will do as well."
"Some allies can become a stone tied around one's neck. Nevertheless, if you wish to play nice with Lady Jamandi, I can simply shrug my shoulders."
"That should prove useful to our friends in {g|Restov}Restov{/g}."
"Just as the {g|Swordlords}Swordlords{/g} value you and your friendship. You can rest assured of that."
"If it's so important to you... I'll send a letter to {g|Restov}Restov{/g} suggesting they repair the road leading to Oleg's Trading Post. Both sides should benefit from that."
"I strongly recommend you find some way to rip her off, just to return the favor."
